keyword: how many calories in california roll
title: How Many Calories in a California Roll?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in california roll, including full nutrition breakdown, macros, and variations for this popular sushi option.
h1: How Many Calories in a California Roll?
assumptions: Standard California roll with imitation crab, avocado, cucumber, seasoned white rice, nori; 8 pieces (~225 g total). No added sauces or sides.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by restaurant, brand, rice portion, ingredient quality, and roll size. Check menus or labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard California roll (8 pieces) contains about 255 kcal and 9 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use brown rice instead of white

faqs.q: How many calories in one California roll?
faqs.a: Approximately 255 kcal for a standard 8-piece roll.

faqs.q: What are the macros in a California roll?
faqs.a: About 38 g carbs, 9 g protein, 7 g fat, with 3 g fiber.
No, due to the riceâ€”38 g carbs per roll; consider low-rice versions.

faqs.q: How much sodium in a California roll?
faqs.a: Around 700 mg, mostly from soy sauce in the rice and fillings.

faqs.q: Does real crab vs. imitation change calories?
faqs.a: Real crab may add 10-20 kcal per roll due to higher protein and slight fat differences.
